column10: The government approved a new decree (DL 6 August 2021 n. 111) containing "Urgent measure for the secure exercise of school, university, social activities and transportation". The decree states for the school year 2021/22 lessons will be in presence from kindergarten to high school, and unless not possible for university. However, social distancing and containment measures remain: pupils (ages 6+) and teachers are required to wear masks, a distance of at least 1 metre is recommended, and entrance to school facilities and buildings is prohibited for those exhibiting respiratory or flu-like symptoms or with a temperature of 37.5 degrees and above. All school personnel has to be in possession of a COVID green pass (EU digital COVID certificate). The pass can be obtained by completing the COVID-19 vaccination cycle, being in possession of a negative molecular or antigen test taken within 48 hours, being in possession of a certificate of recovery from COVID-19 dated within six months. In case of a positive COVID-19 test in a classroom, individual regions/school district officials can decide to forgo normal containment measures in case the entire class is vaccinated. In person schooling can be stopped by region presidents if their region is in a red/orange zone and/or there is an extremely high risk of contagion. Source: http://archive.today/ayxMd | http://archive.today/GyyAg

column75: 14 October 2021    Italy has become the first European country to make COVID-19 health passes mandatory for all workers.    The Italian government approved a new measure on Thursday that makes digital vaccine certificates compulsory for both public and private sectors.    The obligation is set to begin from October 15 and remain in force until the end of the year.    "We are extending the obligation of the green pass to the entire world of work, public and private, and we are doing so for two essential reasons: to make these places safer and to make our vaccination campaign even stronger," health minister Roberto Speranza told the press.    The move aims to improve vaccine uptake and reduce the infection rate amid a potential surge in COVID-19 cases this winter.    While other European countries have made so-called "green passes" mandatory for healthcare workers, Italy is the first to extend the measure to all employees.    https://archive.vn/Sb05d    http://web.archive.org/web/20220106152904/https://www.euronews.com/2021/09/16/italy-set-to-be-first-in-europe-to-require-all-employees-to-have-covid-health-pass
